body.name: In Another World with My Smartphone: Volume 1: In Another World with My Smartphone, Book 1
body.description: After a freak lightning accident zaps him dead, 15-year-old Mochizuki Touya wakes up to find himself face-to-face with God.“I am afraid to say that I have made a bit of a blunder...” laments the old coot. But all is not lost! God says he can reincarnate Touya into a world of fantasy, and as a bonus, he gets to bring his smartphone along with him!So begins Touya's adventure in a new, anachronistic pseudo-medieval world. Friends! Laughs! Tears! Inexplicable Deus ex Machina! He sets off on a journey full of wonder as he absentmindedly travels from place to place, following whatever goal catches his fancy. The curtains lift on an epic tale of swords, sorcery, and smartphone apps! Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Outstanding Young Early Isekai
reviews.reviewText: Ok one thing first I've watched the anime or should I say the first season to many times it along with some other first seasons now when it was around 2016-2018 I would rewatch them all day basking in the glory of my favorite 12 episode(or more) anime. So it was hard a bit to read this but I absolutely love it and can't wait to catch up to the current volume

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A harem isekai handled tastefully and engagingly.
reviews.reviewText: Our protagonist is at first reluctant to engage with his women, but *spoiler* he does eventually make good on the romantic nature of his relationships. There is even love, marriage, and children, not just a bunch of lewd scenes.That aside, this is very light, non-gory fantasy storytelling without a huge lot of murder. Plot armor exists to an extent, derived from Touya himself. I have read every book in this series and I will say you won't eventually hate this guy like Satou from "Death March" or that a-hole MC from "Black " Summoner".

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I can see why this has so many issues
reviews.reviewText: I enjoy this genre and this is a good example, I like the power balance while the main character is extraordinary he still has to grow and learn which is cool, but while on some levels it's like a game world in others its not, what this world needs for reference is a level system seen in similar stories leaving it hard to quantify the power level of the main characters, the magic system is particular to this world and I think its clever I've only read the first book but I'll be buying the second and likely the third

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I’m so excited to start reading the novels. I just love how much the novel has in comparison to the anime. I truly enjoyed it. I find it interesting that Touya was accidentally killed by god and then reincarnated into this world.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Still a power trip fantasy but the MC is likable and he is willing to express his opinion. Even though this is an older one I am surprised the guy is not your typical harem protagonist.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars if you are looking for an epic look elseware this is just a good casual read with no real stakes
reviews.reviewText: Just a fun light read. there is no major imitate danger the hero must face other than trying to figure out how to live in a new world.If you are looking for a simple read this is a great go to. if you desire a story with dire situations go look at the rising of the shield hero.Yes this is a harem story where the main character is surrounded by women but hes aloof to the whole situation, but its charm is in character interactions.If you like character interactions with gags this is a good buy even if you only get this one book it wont be money wasted.if you hate harem stories or stories with no solid direction for its plot other than day to day life. then this is not your book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great little read
reviews.reviewText: If you enjoy the anime then I'd highly recommend the books. The anime has to cut out details to pack a lot of content into the season. Those details that you miss are really worth the time to read. IE Kohaku asks to stay by Touyo's side all of the time. Normally this is not possible since the summoned beast will consume the summoners magic to stay in the world. But Touyo has enough magic to keep a heavenly beast around all of the time. So from this one detail you can surmise that Touyo has amazing magic regenerative powers. The novels are light and the author actually types the books on his smartphone, kinda funny. Also the novels have some extra short stories at the end as well :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I wasn't disappointed
reviews.reviewText: I'm a fan of the isekai genre. I've always enjoyed the anime adaptations so I thought I'd give one of the LN source materials a try. I wasn't disappointed. There was tons more character development in the LN than the anime. The only thing that really got me was the perspective of the story. It seems to be written in a first person style... kind of like you are the protagonist and you're hearing their thoughts as the story progresses... it was just a little confusing until I got used to it.
Lettura piacevole e scorrevole , isekai leggero, semplice e divertente

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 28, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: God made a mistake, but made good by creating an OP body for his unfortunate victim
reviews.reviewText: The premise is a familiar one - someone dies at a time and place they shouldn't, and they are reincarnated in another world.Touya is the unfortunate teenager, who thinks that God reminds him of his old grandfather, and he is very understanding about the mistake that led to his death. He is then reincarnated, and begins his new life in another world.The story is now over 20 volumes long, so it will take a while to get through, but the journey starts as a relaxing one for the reader, as Touya finds his feet, some girls, and some of the advantages of his new body.

Sin tramas enreversadas, enemigos hijos de los tíos sobrinos del rey demonio, héroes elegidos por el destino o un villano malo por que si, está serie es una buena opción para pasar el rato, un protagonista Superman pero sin la invulnerabilidad, visión calorífica o super oído, ni habrá peleas asombrosas pero eso es de lo único que no desearas al leer esta serie, no esperes a un Joker si puedes obtener a un Barry Allen (flash)
I watch the anime last year. It was really amazing, and this book only add more details and minor Stories.

I started watching the anime but the impatient me was like (no, I'm totally going to skip ahead and read it all) as I did, I didn't regret it, there's some things the anime left out so it's not really all that bad. If you're watching the anime or in the near future just finished the anime, give it a whirl. It's great to get more content.
